pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm module¶

pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.HEADERS = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json', 'Accept-encoding': 'application/json'}¶

This section contains functions which operate at the device level

pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.create_dev_vlan(devid, vlanid, vlan_name, auth, url)[source]¶

function takes devid and vlanid vlan_name of specific device and 802.1q VLAN tag and issues a RESTFUL call to add the specified VLAN from the target device. VLAN Name MUST be valid on target device.

Parameters:devid – int or str value of the target device

:param vlanid:int or str value of target 802.1q VLAN

Parameters:
  • vlan_name – str value of the target 802.1q VLAN name. MUST be valid name on target device.
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str HTTP Response code. Should be 201 if successfully created
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> create_dev_vlan = create_dev_vlan('350', '200', 'test vlan', auth.creds, auth.url)
pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.delete_dev_vlans(devid, vlanid, auth, url)[source]¶

function takes devid and vlanid of specific device and 802.1q VLAN tag and issues a RESTFUL call to remove the specified VLAN from the target device. :param vlanid:int or str value of target 802.1q VLAN

Parameters:
  • vlan_name – str value of the target 802.1q VLAN name. MUST be valid name on target device.
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

HTTP response object from requests library. Status code should be 204 if Successful
Return type:

requests.models.Response

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> create_dev_vlan = create_dev_vlan('350', '200', 'test vlan', auth.creds, auth.url)
pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.get_access_interface_vlan(ifIndex, accessinterfacelist, auth, url)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • ifIndex – str object representing the numeric value of the iFindex for the interface
  • accessinterfacelist – list object, intended to be the output of the get_device_access_interfaces function
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str representing the numeric value of the PVID for the target interface.
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> access_interface_list = get_device_access_interfaces('10', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> get_access_interface_vlan('4', access_interface_list, auth.creds, auth.url)
'1'
pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.get_dev_vlans(devid, auth, url)[source]¶

Function takes input of devID to issue RESTUL call to HP IMC

Parameters:
  • devid – str requires devId as the only input parameter
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

list of dictionaries where each element of the list represents one vlan on the target device
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> vlans = get_dev_vlans('350', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(vlans) is list

>>> assert 'vlanId' in vlans[0]
pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.get_device_access_interfaces(devId, auth, url)[source]¶

Function takes devId as input to RESTFUL call to HP IMC platform :param devid: str requires devId as the only input parameter

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

list of dictionaries where each element of the list represents an interface which has been configured as a

VLAN access port

Return type:list 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> access_interfaces = get_device_access_interfaces('10', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(access_interfaces) is list

>>> assert (len(access_interfaces[0])) is 2

>>> assert 'ifIndex' in access_interfaces[0]

>>> assert 'pvid' in access_interfaces[0]
pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm.get_trunk_interfaces(devId, auth, url)[source]¶

Function takes devId as input to RESTFULL call to HP IMC platform

Parameters:
  • devid – str requires devId as the only input parameter
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

list of dictionaries where each element of the list represents an interface which has been configured as a

VLAN trunk port

Return type:list 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.vlanm import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> trunk_interfaces = get_trunk_interfaces('10', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(trunk_interfaces) is list

>>> assert len(trunk_interfaces[0]) == 3

>>> assert 'allowedVlans' in trunk_interfaces[0]

>>> assert 'ifIndex' in trunk_interfaces[0]

>>> assert 'pvid' in trunk_interfaces[0]

>>> get_trunk_interfaces('350', auth.creds, auth.url)
['No trunk inteface']
